data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3523591,"name":"Marco Mendez","username":"MarcoX","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e8c25b/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T17:08:50.023Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello. I am just curious as to how many teams are running power into the RIO port on the VH-109 radio using a VH-117 Poe wall adapter versus just running power from the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePDP\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"CTRE's Power Distribution Panel\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e or \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePDH\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"REV's Power Distribution Hub\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e. Is there a significant difference in using one option versus the other? If using a Poe wall adapter, does it have to be the one from \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eWCP\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"West Coast Products\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e, or can alternative options be used? If so, what would be some good ones? Thank you for taking the time to read this. We do not have any tech mentors on the team, so converting to this new radio has given us some issues.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-10-05T14:33:53.659Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":35,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":229.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":491202,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-set-up","display_username":"Marco Mendez","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51279,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/vh-109-radio-set-up/491202/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3523596,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T17:11:06.233Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eThe wall adapter is only used for powering a 2nd radio on the driver station. It wouldn’t be used for powering the radio on the robot.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-11T17:11:06.233Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":69.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":491202,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-set-up","display_username":"Thad House","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY"},"post_url":"/t/vh-109-radio-set-up/491202/2","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1},{"id":"point_up","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3523608,"name":"Brooke Flynn","username":"BrookeF","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/brookef/{size}/251883_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-11T17:18:33.389Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe are using the Radio Power Module (REV-11-1856) (\u003ca href=\"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/wiring-your-radio#om5p-replacement-rpm\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003ein this config\u003c/a\u003e). We don’t trust that the roboRIO will produce enough power for POE to the radio. I would recommend using \u003ca href=\"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1210/\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003ea POE injector cable\u003c/a\u003e or \u003ca href=\"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/wiring-your-radio#om5p-replacement-vrm\" rel=\"noopener nofollow ugc\"\u003epowering the radio straight from the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePDP\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"CTRE's Power Distribution Panel\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e/\u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePDH\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"REV's Power Distribution Hub\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/a\u003e (using the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eVRM\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Voltage Regulator Module\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e).\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-02-11T17:25:20.989Z","reply_count":3,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":62.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":491202,"topic_slug":"vh-109-radio-set-up","display_username":"Brooke Flynn","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://frc-radio.vivid-hosting.net/overview/wiring-your-radio#om5p-replacement-rpm","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":10},{"url":"https://www.revrobotics.com/rev-11-1210/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"POE Injector Cable -
